newsitem.title: USA: TVA boosts output at 1,170 MW Tenn. nuke.
newsitem.headline: TVA boosts output at 1,170 MW Tenn. nuke.

text.p: Tennessee Valley Authority (TVA) said Monday it was boosting output at its 1,170 megawatt (MW) Watts Bar 1 nuclear power unit after "insulator smoldering" Friday forced it to throttle back production.
TVA spokesman Tom Tohill blamed the smoking insulation on "a very small oil leak" in the unit's feedwater pump.
While repairs were underway, Watts Bar 1's output fell to 66 percent of capacity, Tohill said, adding it was operating earlier today at approximately at 1,038 MW, or 88.7 percent power.
He did not have a time for when the plant likely would again reach full output.
Watts Bar 1, located between Chattanooga and Knoxville, Tenn., accounts for three percent of TVA's total generation capacity.
